title: Three Dialogues between Hylas and Philonous
sourceDesc: Berkeley’s [Dialogues between Hylas and Philonous] was first published in 1713. Our copytext is the third edition of 1734, and the text derives from David Wilkins’s online edition.

author: George Berkeley

blocks.content: £4 THREE £4 £1 DIALOGUES £1 £4 ^between^ £4 £2 _Hylas_ and _Philonous_. £2 £5 The Design of which £5 Is plainly to demonstrate the Reality and Perfection of ^Human Knowledge^, the Incorporeal Nature of the ^Soul^, and the Immediate Providence of a ^Deity^: £5 In OPPOSITION to £5 £3 SCEPTICS and ATHEISTS. £3 £5 ALSO £5 To open a Method for rendring the ^Sciences^ more easy, useful, and compendious.
